page.title: 13Willsbridge Nature Trail.
page.content: The Avon Wildlife Trust are con- verting Willsbridge Mill and Valley into a Wildlife and Countryside Centre. Siston Brook was dammed in 1730 .The first mill was an iron mill and then became a corn mill, but in 1968 there was a flood and the dam was destroyed. The mill was so damaged that it could not work any more. The Trust have created a wildlife garden, with an area for butterflies, an area for bees, a wildflower meadow and trees with berries to attract birds. Two ponds have been created by the mill to attract wildlife. The mill is being turned into a visitor centre and classrooms are being built. The valley is very quiet and beautiful. The nature trail takes about an hour walking slowly.
